In Short
Luis Enrique parted ways with Spain on Thursday
Gavi thanked Enrique for trusting him
The young midfielder said that the players will always be grateful towards Enrique
By India Today Web Desk: Spain midfielder Gavi has penned an emotional message on social media, thanking former Spain manager Luis Enrique for the faith he showed in him.
Enrique parted ways with the former World Champions on Thursday, a day after their Round of 16 loss to Morocco on Tuesday.
The Spain football federation went on to name the country's U-21 team coach, Luis de la Fuente, as the replacement for the former Barcelona tactician.
"The RFEF has chosen Luis de la Fuente as the new (Spain) coach," RFEF said in a statement.
The RFEF would like to thank Luis Enrique and his entire coaching staff for the work done in the last few years."
Spain's defeat to Morocco was the only major upset in the Round of 16 as the field has been set for the quarterfinals of the World Cup.

"The ... RFEF has delivered to the president a report in which it determined that a new project should start for the Spain national team, with the aim of continuing the growth achieved in recent years thanks to the work carried out by Luis Enrique (and the staff).
The RFEF would like to thank Luis Enrique and his entire coaching staff for the work done in the last few years."
The Barca midfielder wished Enrique success in the future and completed the message by saying that the team will be always grateful towards him.

"Both the president, Luis Rubiales, and the sporting director, Jose Francisco Molina, have told the coach their decision," the Spanish FA said in a statement.

Luis de la Fuente was named as Spain's new coach on Thursday, shortly after Luis Enrique was sacked following the team's exit from the World Cup.
The Spanish football federation confirmed the elevation of their under-21s boss two days after the 2010 champions were eliminated at the last-16 stage in Qatar by Morocco.
Spain sacked coach Luis Enrique on Thursday after the 2010 champions were dumped out of the World Cup by Morocco at the last-16 stage earlier this week.

Spain hammered Costa Rica 7-0 in their opening game in Qatar but suffered a shock defeat by Japan that resulted in a second-place finish in Group E.

Spain were strong favourites to beat Morocco in the first knockout round but lost 3-0 on penalties after the game finished 0-0 following extra-time.
The federation said they wanted to thank Luis Enrique and his staff for their work, but had decided to start a "new project".

"The sporting direction of the RFEF has given the president a report, in which it was determined that a new project should start for the national team, with the objective of continuing the growth achieved in the last few years thanks to Luis Enrique and his colleagues," added the RFEF.

The RFEF would like to thank Luis Enrique and his entire coaching staff for the work done in the last few years.ï¿½

The 52-year-old said after the Morocco match that he was to blame for the defeat.
Luis Enrique, who was first appointed Spain coach in 2018, had a contract until the end of the year.
He is the fourth manager to get sacked after their teams were eliminated at the World Cup in Qatar.

Dec. 8 (UPI) -- Spain fired manager Luis Enrique after an upset loss to Morocco at the 2022 World Cup, the Spanish Football Federation announced Thursday.
"The [Spanish Football Federation] would like to thank Luis Enrique and his entire coaching staff at the helm of the absolute national team in recent years," the Spanish Football Federation said.
"The [federation] has chosen Luis de la Fuente as the new national coach.
Enrique, 52, previously coached at Roma, Celta and Barcelona.
He joined Spain as a coach in 2018, but left briefly for personal reasons.
